Journal.Title: Huan jing ke xue= Huanjing kexue

Article.ArticleTitle: [Effect of Ozonation on Microorganism in the Biological Activated Carbon and Disinfection By-Products in the Effluent].

AbstractText: This study was carried out in the ozone (O<sub>3</sub>) and biological activated carbon (BAC) section of a drinking water plant to investigate the effects of O<sub>3</sub> on microbial and effluent disinfection by-products (DBPs) in BAC during drinking water treatment. The water quality, dissolved organic matter (DOM) characteristics, microbial activity, and DBPs formation at different O<sub>3</sub> concentrations were analyzed. Results showed that the effect of O<sub>3</sub> on microorganisms is mainly that it increased the utilization efficiency of DOM. However, excessive O<sub>3</sub> increased the amount of organic matter such as protein and microbial metabolites (SMPs) in the effluent. When the O<sub>3</sub> concentration increased from 0 mg·L<sup>-1</sup> to 2.0 mg·L<sup>-1</sup>, the survival rate of microorganisms in the BAC decreased from 95.10% to 62.60%. However, since O<sub>3</sub> transforms organic matter into a biodegradable substance, we found that microbial activity increased by 62.52% and that the biofiltration of the BAC was enhanced. When the O<sub>3</sub> concentration was further increased to 4.0 mg·L<sup>-1</sup>, the microbial survival rate decreased to 49.9% and the protein and SMPs produced by the microorganisms increased. This resulted in an increased formation of carbon-containing DBPs (C-DBPs) and nitrogen-containing DBPs (N-DBPs) by 41.93% and 7.18%, respectively. In summary, an appropriate dosage of O<sub>3</sub> was beneficial for removing DOM by O<sub>3</sub>-BAC, but we found that an excessive O<sub>3</sub> concentration caused the formation of new DBPs precursors.
